0.cdata!:
Royaume du Maroc - Quatrieme Projet de
            Credit Agricole

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Fourth Agricultural
            Credit Project for Morocco were to finance: (a) livestock
            and irrigation and agricultural equipment for small farmers;
            (b) mechanization for Agrarian Reform Cooperatives; (c)
            mechanization, irrigation equipment and land improvement for
            medium and large farmers; (d) agro industry mainly for oil
            processing, flour milling, milk pasteurization; and (e) a
            computerized monitoring and evaluation system. The project
            was successful in meeting its main objective of increasing
            production through financing production investments on
            individual farms. It was less successful in promoting
            agrarian reform cooperatives and agro industries and in
            helping to establish an efficient monitoring and evaluation
            (M&E) system in National Agricultural Credit Bank
            (CNCA). The loan was closed on August 31, 1983 with an eight
            month delay. This was in part due to the delays of
            effectiveness. However, two other major reasons were the
            severe 1980-81 drought which curtailed investment and credit
            recovery and the fast appreciation of the US$ which slowed
            down loan disbursements compared with CNCA's own disbursements.
